t: Proverbs 7
Warning Against the Adulterous Woman
My*pn son, keep my words and*ld store up my commands within you.
Keep*ln my commands and you will live; guard*ld my teachings as the apple of your eye.
Bind*ln them on your fingers; write*ld them on the tablet of your heart.
Say*ln to wisdom, “You are my sister,” and*ld to insight, “You are my relative.”
They*ln will keep you from the adulterous woman, from*ld the wayward woman with her seductive words.
At*pn the window of my house I*ld looked down through the lattice.
I*ln saw among the simple, I*ld noticed among the young men, a*ld youth who had no sense.
He*ln was going down the street near her corner, walking*ld along in the direction of her house
at*ln twilight, as the day was fading, as*ld the dark of night set in.
Then*pn out came a woman to meet him, dressed*ld like a prostitute and with crafty intent.
(She*ln is unruly and defiant, her*ld feet never stay at home;
now*ln in the street, now in the squares, at*ld every corner she lurks.)
She*ln took hold of him and kissed him and*ld with a brazen face she said:
“Today*pn I fulfilled my vows, and*ld I have food from my fellowship offering at home.
So*ln I came out to meet you; I*ld looked for you and have found you!
I*ln have covered my bed with*ld colored linens from Egypt.
I*ln have perfumed my bed with*ld myrrh, aloes and cinnamon.
Come,*ln let’s drink deeply of love till morning; let’s*ld enjoy ourselves with love!
My*ln husband is not at home; he*ld has gone on a long journey.
He*ln took his purse filled with money and*ld will not be home till full moon.”
With*pn persuasive words she led him astray; she*ld seduced him with her smooth talk.
All*ln at once he followed her like*ld an ox going to the slaughter, like*ln a deer stepping into a noose
till*ld an arrow pierces his liver, like*ln a bird darting into a snare, little*ld knowing it will cost him his life.
Now*pn then, my sons, listen to me; pay*ld attention to what I say.
Do*ln not let your heart turn to her ways or*ld stray into her paths.
Many*ln are the victims she has brought down; her*ld slain are a mighty throng.
Her*ln house is a highway to the grave, leading*ld down to the chambers of death.
